org.latency4j

Class Latency4JException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • org.latency4j.Latency4JException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Latency4JException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException

    Root class of all Latency4J exceptions.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public Latency4JException(java.lang.String message)

      • Latency4JException

        public Latency4JException(java.lang.Throwable cause)

        Wraps the specified exception with an instance of this class. Generally used to encapsulate an error triggered or detected by an underlying API.

        Parameters:
        cause - The exception to be wrapped.
        See Also:
        ExceptionUtil.getStackTrace(Throwable)

      • Latency4JException

        public Latency4JException(java.lang.String message,
                          java.lang.Throwable cause)

        Wraps an underlying exception as an instance of this type, but also masks the message with that specified in the constructor arguments.

        Although constructor Latency4JException(Throwable) can be used to wrap an underlying exception, it does not mask the underlying's message. So a call to the method Throwable.getMessage() will still return the message of the underlying exception.

        This constructor allows for a substitute message (or mask) to be defined, which is the returned by Throwable.getMessage() instead of that of the wrapped exception.

        Parameters:
        message - The message mask, also referred to as the description of the exception.
        cause - The exception to be wrapped by this instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getStackTraceAsString

        public java.lang.String getStackTraceAsString()

        Convenience method for transforming the instance's stack trace to a String.

        Returns:
        A String representation of the instance's stack trace.

      • wrapException

        public static Latency4JException wrapException(java.lang.Throwable exce)

        Wraps the specified exception with an Latency4JException if it is not already one.

        Parameters:
        exce - The Exception to wrap.
        Returns:
        If the specified Exception is an Latency4JException, this method will simply return a reference to it. Else, it will return a new Latency4JException initialised with the specified parameter.
